programme.title: Gordon Behind Bars: Episode 2
programme.desc: As Gordon's business gets busier, the prison's stringent systems and routines start getting to him, and he struggles to keep his brigade together. Serial offender Lawrence loses it in the kitchen and tries to attack another prisoner, and the authorities stop Jerome from being able to bake.

programme.title: Gordon Behind Bars: Episode 3
programme.desc: After two months of success, Gordon now wants to expand the prisoner's food selections and go commercial. Meanwhile the team has dwindled down yet again.

programme.title: Gordon Behind Bars: Episode 4
programme.desc: The six months are up, the team is now even smaller, and everything is now on the line. Can it all be a success? Can lives be turned around? Will the program be allowed to continued?

programme.title: Serving In Secret: Love, Country, and Don't Ask, Don't Tell
programme.desc: In 1970, Tom Carpenter graduated from the Naval Academy ready to follow his family’s lineage in the military as a US Marine Corps attack pilot. Then he met Courtland Hirschi. Tom and Court fell deeply in love, keeping their illicit relationship a secret. At that time, homosexuality – if discovered – resulted in being kicked out of the military with a dishonorable discharge, a court martial, jail time, or worse… Tom and Court’s story would be no exception. ‘Serving in Secret’ features leading voices in politics, historians, civil rights activists, and retired military personnel telling the story of LGBTQ discrimination in the military, and the controversial compromise known as “Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell.” Tom’s work towards its repeal along with many others was the Turning Point for LGBTQ+ rights, a fight that continues today.

programme.title: Betty Feeds The Animals
programme.desc: Betty loves animals, she loves them so much that everyday she puts 30 bowls of food outside of her home to feed them. She feeds skunks, raccoons, cats, foxes and the occasional opossum. This is her story. Directed by James P. Gannon.

programme.title: Elder
programme.desc: A Mormon missionary finds his world turned upside down when he falls in love with a handsome, Italian Communist. With original 8mm film Tom Clark recounts a love story on the coast of Italy. Directed by Genéa Gaudet.

programme.title: How To Make A Rainbow
programme.desc: The story of a young girl and her mother, observed over the course of two years, as they move together through transitions of home, identity and name. Directed by Ryan Maxey.

programme.title: Cherry Pop: The Story Of The World's Fanciest Cat
programme.desc: Cherry Pop was no ordinary cat. Beloved by her wealthy socialite owners, she lived life in the lap of luxury. This delightful story will tickle your funny bone and touch your heart. Directed by Kareem Tabsch.

programme.title: Pickle Man
programme.desc: Facing certain death by ALS, Arthur Cohen decides to leave a legacy of pickles. PickALS, that is. Arthur is brilliant, hilarious and courageous in this intimate portrait of a man facing a brutal disease. Directed by Nastasya Popov.

programme.title: Harry & Meghan: A Windsor Wedding
programme.desc: You are invited to the most anticipated royal event of the year. The long awaited wedding of Great Britain's Prince Harry and American actress, activist and sweetheart Meghan Markle. Featuring the complete first ever public interview of the couple together on 27th November 2017, it also features testimonials and interviews from the people who know them the best. Directed by Jordan Hill.

programme.title: Elvis & Priscilla: Conditional Love
programme.desc: Elvis and Priscilla are one of the most famous celebrity couples of all time. But the story that lies beneath the glamorous facade is more toxic than what first meets the eye. Elvis has defined Pricilla's life. His comment that she was "young enough that he could train her any way he wanted,", in the end, came true. Though their relationship was bound by true love, what were the conditions that let it flourish? Directed by Finlay Bald.

programme.title: Paperboy Love Prince Runs for Mayor
programme.desc: Rapper and street performer Paperboy Love Prince takes on the political elite in the race for NYC mayor. Directed by Owen Dubeck.

programme.title: Quiet Minds Silent Streets
programme.desc: Quiet Minds Silent Streets introduces viewers to a community that has been chronically affected by gun violence. This thoughtful, eye-opening documentary asks whether they can find a new way forward with a relatively simple technique: mindfulness and meditation. Executive produced by Director X and directed by Karen Chapman.

programme.title: Five Star
programme.desc: With 41 full-ride Division 1 scholarship offers, Brandon Jones is one of the most heavily recruited high school football players in the country. Directed by Ryan Booth.

programme.title: Mister Sunshine
programme.desc: Meet the millionaire who became a shoeshine man peddling goodwill and cheer throughout Auckland. Larry Woods provides brilliant thoughts on how to live a happy life. Directed by Eldon Booth.

programme.title: Jonah
programme.desc: An interview with a formerly enslaved African American man accompanies a powerful modern day dance vignette. The juxtaposition of past and present raises questions about inherited trauma and the possibility of regeneration. Directed by Andrew Michael Ellis.

programme.title: Kobe Bryant: A Tribute
programme.desc: The sudden and tragic passing of Kobe Bryant, alongside his young daughter Gianna left the world in a stunned silence. Never before has a sporting star held such high esteem outside of their profession… But Kobe Bryant was a superstar. Unmatched on the basketball court and cherished on the red carpet– Kobe’s dedication to his career, his family and his charity work led to him being adored the world over. Directed by Danielle Winter.

programme.title: Chris Rock: One Man Show
programme.desc: This hilarious, unapologetic, hard-working comic with sharp social punchlines hasnâ€™t always had it easy. In fact he draws his comedy from a darker side of his past. We look back at the life and rise of the one who was once named the funniest man in America. Directed by Roxane Schlumberger

programme.title: Lewis Hamilton: The Winning Formula
programme.desc: As the only black Formula One driver in history, Lewis' journey to becoming the most decorated Formula One driver in history, is one of dreams, courage, and determination. Directed by Piers Garland.

programme.title: The Last 24 Hours: Jimi Hendrix
programme.desc: This documentary offers an in-depth look at Jimi Hendrix's last 24 hours and attempts to clear the air surrounding his tragic passing by including appearances and testimonials from some of the people that knew him best. Directed by Mike Parkinson.

programme.title: Beyonce: Queen B
programme.desc: One of the most recognizable figures in contemporary music. Get lost in the ultimate story of modern day superstardom as we take you through the incredible journey of Beyoncé. Directed by Billy Simpson.

programme.title: Meghan Markle: American Duchess
programme.desc: Meghan's rise to the top of British society revealed some deep- seated issues in a multicultural country. How did the most adored woman in the world become the subject of such vicious tabloid gossip? Directed by Lucy Ciara McCutcheon.

programme.title: The Sentence of Michael Thompson
programme.desc: In 1994, Michael Thompson was arrested for selling three pounds of cannabis and was sentenced to 42 to 60 years in prison. He is the longest serving non-violent offender in the history of Michigan and he is finally up for clemency. Directed by Kyle Thrash and Haley Elizabeth Anderson. A DOCUMENTARY+ Original.

programme.title: Lazarus
programme.desc: Lazarus is a short documentary following Lazarus Chigwandali, a street musician with Albinism from Malawi as he teams up with a London-based music producer to record his debut album. Directed by David Darg.

programme.title: Pack & Soul : Disconnection Censored
programme.desc: Episode 1 - Disconnection. The start of a 2,193 mile journey on the Appalachian Trail.

programme.title: Pack & Soul : Disintegration Censored
programme.desc: Episode 2 - Disintegration. Hollywood hikes into potential devastation on the trail.

programme.title: Pack & Soul : Perception Censored
programme.desc: Episode 3 - Perception. Hollywood is back on trail with something to prove.

programme.title: Pack & Soul : Negotiation Censored
programme.desc: Episode 4 - Negotiation. Hollywood finds a deeper meaning to the trail.

programme.title: Pack & Soul : Habitation Censored
programme.desc: Episode 5 - Habitation. Hollywood finds steady footing on trail, carving his name beside all who have come before.

programme.title: Pack & Soul : Revelation Censored
programme.desc: Episode 6 - Revelation. Hollywood turns inward. Through the lives and stories of others, he finds what's truly needed to get to Maine.

programme.title: Serving In Secret: Love, Country, and Don't Ask, Don't Tell
programme.desc: In 1970, Tom Carpenter graduated from the Naval Academy ready to follow his family’s lineage in the military as a US Marine Corps attack pilot. Then he met Courtland Hirschi. Tom and Court fell deeply in love, keeping their illicit relationship a secret. At that time, homosexuality – if discovered – resulted in being kicked out of the military with a dishonorable discharge, a court martial, jail time, or worse… Tom and Court’s story would be no exception. ‘Serving in Secret’ features leading voices in politics, historians, civil rights activists, and retired military personnel telling the story of LGBTQ discrimination in the military, and the controversial compromise known as “Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell.” Tom’s work towards its repeal along with many others was the Turning Point for LGBTQ+ rights, a fight that continues today.

programme.title: Muxes
programme.desc: In the southern state of Oaxaca where, in the indigenous communities around the town of Juchitán, the world is not divided simply into males and females. The local Zapotec people have made room for a third category, which they call “muxes” - men who consider themselves women and live in a socially sanctioned limbo between the two genders. Directed by Ivan Olita.

programme.title: Elder
programme.desc: A Mormon missionary finds his world turned upside down when he falls in love with a handsome, Italian Communist. With original 8mm film Tom Clark recounts a love story on the coast of Italy. Directed by Genéa Gaudet.

programme.title: How To Make A Rainbow
programme.desc: The story of a young girl and her mother, observed over the course of two years, as they move together through transitions of home, identity and name. Directed by Ryan Maxey.

programme.title: Girls Section
programme.desc: In remote North Pakistan, a quiet revolution is growing. For the first time, girls in the region are challenging tradition for their right to go to school. Directed by Kathryn Everett.

programme.title: Life In Miniature
programme.desc: Kath Holden is an artist of the everyday. Inspired by the world around her, Kath's creations are whimsical yet keenly observed, and a far cry from the genteel museum pieces that her contemporaries are producing. A proud Yorkshire woman, Kath reflects on her life and art as she carves a place for herself in the precious world of miniatures. Directed by Ellen Evans.

programme.title: Mister Sunshine
programme.desc: Meet the millionaire who became a shoeshine man peddling goodwill and cheer throughout Auckland. Larry Woods provides brilliant thoughts on how to live a happy life. Directed by Eldon Booth.

programme.title: Balloonfest
programme.desc: The city of Cleveland was abuzz on September 27, 1986. Over 1.5 million balloons were about to be released at once, breaking the world record. What could go wrong? Directed by Nathan Truesdell.

programme.title: Bodega De Edgar
programme.desc: The courageous story of Edgar Torres immigrating to the US illegally with his father in the 80’s, becoming a wine expert and starting a winery in Paso Robles, CA to give his children a better future. Directed by Nick Cavalier.

programme.title: The Thousand Year Journey
programme.desc: "Routine is the enemy of time." Jedidiah Jenkins rides his bicycle from Oregon to Patagonia, the southern tip of South America, while expounding upon ideas that made him leave a job he loved for the open road. Directed by Kenny Laubbacher.

programme.title: Five Stone Of Lead
programme.desc: On the west coast of Ireland kids don’t dream about winning the world cup, they dream about being championship jockeys. This is the story of a 12 year old jockey, Dylan, who is tiny even for a jockey. Directed by Jonny Madderson and Jono Stevens.

programme.title: The Blessings Of Aging
programme.desc: The sweet and sassy residents of a retirement community explain the many upsides of getting older. Directed by Jenny Schweitzer Bell.

programme.title: The Magic Of Chess
programme.desc: Filmed at the 2019 Elementary Chess Championships at the Nashville Opryland resort, a group of children share their insights about the benefits of chess. Directed by Jenny Schweitzer Bell.

programme.title: Strike
programme.desc: Bill Fong is passionate about bowling. One seeming ordinary night all may change for this underdog as Fong begins to get strike after strike, nearing the ever elusive 'perfect series.' Directed by Joey Daoud.

programme.title: Muxes
programme.desc: In the southern state of Oaxaca where, in the indigenous communities around the town of Juchitán, the world is not divided simply into males and females. The local Zapotec people have made room for a third category, which they call “muxes” - men who consider themselves women and live in a socially sanctioned limbo between the two genders. Directed by Ivan Olita.

programme.title: Picture Locked
programme.desc: Filmmakers Bryan and Amy Storkel breakdown their documentary "Holy Rollers" which follows a blackjack team of devoted card-counting Christians as they win millions from casinos. Directed by Yasir Masood & James Rohan.

programme.title: Picture Locked
programme.desc: Filmmaker Clay Tweel breaks down his documentary "Finders Keepers" which tracks an amputee’s stranger-than-fiction battle to reclaim his long-lost mummified leg. Directed by Yasir Masood & James Rohan.

programme.title: Picture Locked
programme.desc: Filmmaker Matt Ogens breaks down his documentary "Confessions of a Superhero" which chronicles the lives of costumed performers on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. Directed by Yasir Masood & James Rohan.

programme.title: Picture Locked
programme.sub-title: Picture Locked: Chris Temple & Zach Ingrasci
programme.desc: Filmmakers Chris Temple and Zach Ingrasci break down their work, including "Five Years North." Directed by Yasir Masood & Victor Kamwendo.
